CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1952, pg. 23, reads: "'Bess you is 'our' woman now' - This is what the three Porgys in Blevins Davis - Robert Breen revival of 'Porgy and Bess,' currently playing at the Nixon Theatre, are singing to Bess during a break in rehearsal Monday. Left to right: Pittsburgh's own Irving Barnes, understudy, who will sing the role of Porgy in a special matinee Friday, July 25; LeVerne Hutcherson; alternate Porgy, and William Warfield (seated) who sings the leading role of Porgy during the current run.  Miss Leontyne Price gains new laurels in her vocal career by her brilliant portrayal of Bess. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: "Porgy and Bess" cast with Porgy understudy Irving Barnes, alternate LeVerne Hutcherson, and leading William Warfield singing to "Bess" Leontyne Price, in dressing room of Nixon Theatre
